0.name: Entrance to The Warriors' Tavern
desc: "   You find yourself standing in the very center of the Market Plaza.
Although there used to be a fountain here, it was relocated when the
partially underground Warriors' Tavern was built, thus smoothing
the flow of traffic across town. A steep tunnel leads down into the earth;
fortunately, there are steps and handrails to prevent you from slipping.

1.name: The Rest Room
desc: "   The room you are in stretches off into the distance farther than you can
see.  Large, durable lockers line the entire east wall, and triply bunked
beds run along the west wall, many of them occupied by people who have
temporarily embarked on voyages in another land.  There is a desk right at
the entrance where a receptionist waits to store people's valuables when
they decide to sleep for a time.
1.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, nosteal, no_magic, rent_room, fast_moves, mapable

2.name: North Market Plaza
desc: "   The din of the crowd around you fills your ears, even at this hour.  Who
would have thought that so few people could make so much noise?  The Plaza
stretches its way to the east and west from here, and a cheerful, well-used
road leads north to the Midgard Cathedral of Virtue.  A flight of stairs
leading down into the ground south of here marks the site of The Underground.

3.name: Northeast Market Plaza
desc: "   Through the bussle of the crowd you make out a row of shops lining the
plaza corner.  To the north, you spy a key-shaped sign labeled, 'Candles
and Hooks.'  Judging by the smell, you would guess that there is some sort
of bakery to the east.  The plaza continues to the south and west.

4.name: East Market Plaza
desc: "   The crowds have thinned enough for you to catch your breath and get a
look at your surroundings.  West of you, an opening in the ground provides
access to The Underground, where people go to rest, relax, and shoot the
breeze.  Several shops are located to the north and south, and Main Street
winds off to the east.

5.name: Southeast Market Plaza
desc: "   This corner of the Market Plaza is host to 'The Cow's Bounty', the finest
leatherworks shop in the city, and the Midgard Information Centre, where
you'll find a well-spring of advice on navigating Midgard's web of roads
and shops.  The plaza continues to the north and west.

6.name: South Market Plaza
desc: "   Your travels have taken you to the southern-most part of Midgard's Market
Plaza.  The crowds thicken to the east and west, centering around the
Information Center and the Bank, respectively.  Woodmar Way stretches off
to the south, where the roof of the Shrine of Neutrality is just barely
visible above the surrounding buildings, and the entrance to The Underground,
Midgard's finest tavern, lies to the north.

7.name: Southwest Market Plaza
desc: "   This is the most affluent corner of the plaza, and with good reason.
To the west lies the Midgard Bank, while some sort of jewlery store sits
along the southern curb.  The plaza continues to the north and east.

8.name: West Market Plaza
desc: "  You stand on the western-most edge of Midgard's famous Market Plaza.
Main street leads off to the west, and the Plaza extends to the north
and south.  The sole entrance to The Underground (best tavern in town,
or even below it!) lies to the east, and you here the faint sounds of
singing and laughter rising from below.

9.name: Northwest Market Plaza
desc: "   Like all corners of the plaza, the north-east region is lined with
shops.  Somehow though, this corner seems more...peculiar.  Maybe it
has something to do with the odd little blue booth perched on the
curb to the west.  Above the booth hangs a metal plaque with some
writing on it.  On the northern curb lies one of the most curious shops
in the land, 'Osfol's Shoppe of Wonderous Things'.  The rest of the
plaza lies to the south and west.
Quick-Go Rapid Transit System
When you positively have to be there this very second...

10.name: The Provisions Shoppe
desc: "   An assortment of lanterns, ropes, and other adventuring equipment
adorns the walls of 'Candles and Hooks'.  A small note describing the
shop's inventory lies on the counter.  Exits lead south onto the Market
Plaza and west to Woodmar Lane.

11.name: The Bakery
desc: "   You are standing inside the small bakery.  A sweet scent of Danish and
fine bread fills the room.  The bread and Danish are arranged in fine order
on the shelves, and seem to be of the finest quality. The only exit
leads west to the plaza.

12.name: The Leather Shop
desc: "   Welcome to 'The Cow's Bounty'!  If it's a leather good, it's bound
to be here.  Clothes racks around the store show off the finest in
leather equipment.  Almost everything you glance at is well oiled and
in wonderful condition.  Exits to the north and west lead to Main Street
and the plaza, respectively.

13.name: Midgard Information Centre
desc: "   This is rather large for an information center.  Although you were
expecting a tiny booth, this seems to be just as large as any of the
other shops.  A beautifully crafted map of Midgard covers most of the
west wall.  The only way out is to the north.
Glancing around one last time, you notice a huge POSTER hanging
from the south wall.  Perhaps you should LOOK AT it?
Welcome to New Midgard.
We hope that you won't get lost, but if you ever do, just keep walking
till you see a large block of marble embedded into the ground.  They're
usually found at most major intersections and always have a map eteched
on their surface.  To help you get started, there are several posters
here you can look at.
The STREET map will show you how the layout works around here.
The GUILD poster has a map of where all the guilds in town are located.
and the ZONE poster will give you a feel as to what parts of town might
carry what shops.
Oh yeah...I almost forgot.  There's also a SHOP poster which will tell
you where to find just about anything!
Happy Traveling! (And don't forget to look for those MAPS at all major
intersections...they'll keep you on the right track!)
W o r d s   t o   t h e   W i s e
Try using the Quick-Go boothes...they're the fastest way around town.
There's even a Quick-Go booth inside Market Plaza!
Need a place to stay for the night?  Try the Owl's Nest Inn.  Just go
south from Market Plaza to Woodmar Lane.  It's there on the west side
of the street.
L o c a t i o n   I n d e x
Places of worship
The Cathedral of Virtue        The north end of town, Just above Market Plaza
The Cathedral of Corruption    The south end of town, Just below the wharf.
The Shrine of Neutrality       Right in the middle of town...can't miss it.
Shops
The Bakery                     The northeast corner of Market Plaza
The Provisions Shoppe.         The northeast corner of Market Plaza
The Cow's Bounty               The southeast corner of Market Plaza
Rings and Things               The southwest corner of Market Plaza
Cafe De Midgard                Just south or MarketPlaza on Woodmar Lane
The Pet Shoppe                 A bit east of MarketPlaza on MainStreet
The Fisherman's Wharf          A good ways down MainStreet to the east.
Mystil's Mystics               All the way over on western Iron Road
Arms
The Small Arms Shoppe          Just west of Market Plaza on Main Street
The Blacksmith                 All the way over on eastern Iron Road
The Armoury                    All the way over on eastern Iron Road
The Weapon Shoppe              All the way over on eastern Iron Road
Chay's Bows and Slings         Way down on Woodmar, south of the Shrine
The Happy Fletcher             Way down on Woodmar, south of the Shrine
Misc
Midgard Bank                   The southwest corner of Market Plaza
Midgard Information Centre     Your standing in it :)
The Silver Feather Tavern      A bit down MainStreet, west of Market Plaza
The Museum of Midgard          Just west on MainStreet.
Osfol's Shop of Wonderous Things  Northwest corner of Market Plaza
Quick-Go Booths                4 in the 4 corners of town.
The Midgard Shopping Centre    A good ways down western Main Street
The Infirmary                  A bit to the south on Woodmar Lane
The Owl's Nest Inn             A bit to the south on Woodmar Lane

14.name: The Midgard Auction Hall
desc: "   A large room with a high ceiling, the Midgard Auction Hall is arrayed
with splendid artifacts and items for sale.  In the center, on a grand
pedestal, stands the Auctioneer himself, shouting out the current items,
bids, and prices.  Occasionally he takes items from the crowd, as citizens
give their unwanted items to him in order to make a little profit.  Some he
takes, some he refuses.
There is a large SIGN on the wall.
"   To auction an item, give it to the auctioneer.  Do not try to auction
junk, he will just give it right back.  You must specify a minimum bid for
your item, by TELLing him the bid, in the form "tell auctioneer min ###" where
### is whatever you want the minimum to be.  A minimum of 0 means there is
no minimum bid.  Should you fail to supply a minimum bid, either he will
hold it for a while and sell other items, or if enough time has passed he
will begin to sell it with no minimum bid.  You may only auction one item
at a time.  You may not bid on an item you have put up for sale.  You may
not bid on an item another one of your characters has put up for sale.  You
can BID on an item similar to setting a min, by TELLing it to him: "tell
auctioneer bid ###" where ### is your bid.  You must either bid OVER the
current bid, or if you are the first bidder you must match the MIN set by
the seller.  You must have the money ON YOUR PERSON in order to bid, because
once you put a bid in, you cannot leave until you have bought the item or
someone out-bids you.  If you have sold an item, and have not come to pick
it up, he will hold it for a reasonable amount of time, and if you have
not come to pick it up within that time, he will resell it.  To pay for an
item, simply GIVE the auctioneer coins equal to the price you bought it for.
He will then give you your item, and if the seller is around, will give him
his profit.  The auctioneer will keep a percentage of the fee.
(If there are any questions about this, ask an immortal for help, especially
if you feel there is a bug.)

15.name: Midgard Bank
desc: "   A small fountain in the center of the room playfully throws jets of
water into the air.  The floor is a rose-colored marble with streaks of
grey, white and black.  Definitely high class.  A small teller window
is set into the west wall.  A small sign rests on the counter.

16.name: A Quick-Go Booth
desc: QUICK-GO BOOTH
Midgard's Public Access Teleportation System
This port connects to the:
M A R K E T   P L A Z A
Please step east if this is your stop.  Special thanks
to our sponsor, Osfol's Shoppe of Wonderous Things.
Have a nice day. =)

17.name: Osfol's Shoppe of Wonderous Things
desc: "   All sorts of oddities hang from every available spot.  Strange
types of headgear hang from the ceiling and bizarre animals scurry
around in glass cages.  Near the back of the store, you catch a
glance at what appears to be the shopkeeper.  An exit leads south
to the Market Plaza

18.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   The road here is well-paved with cobblestones and two gutters to
either side drain away most of the rain water.  A bit further to the
north, you make out the silhouette of the fameous Cathedral of Virtue.
A large key hangs above the door of a shop to the east; probably some
sort of provision shop.  The Market Plaza lies to the south.
It looks like there has been a recent accident or explosion of some
kind here as there is a large fissure in the road. Someone has posted a
large sign next to it.
"   Warning due to some magical experiments by our local mages we now have
a very large hole in our road. Unfortunatly this has occured right over our
old defunt sewer system so the stench is fairly bad. There have been reports
of sightings of rabid bats and a few other odd monsters. This area is not
for the faint at heart or the young adventurer. Please be sure you really
want to proceed before going down as it probably isnt possible to get back
up the way you go down. The local mages, city council and dietys of the realm
wont be responsible for any lives that may extinguish below.

19.name: The Clerics' Guild
desc: "  The entrance to the Clerics Guild is modest in appearance, reflecting
the true nature of the Cleric.  Bare stone walls stand unadorned save
for an occasional passage from the scripture carved with a careful hand.
Nondescript stone portals lead both east and west.

20.name: The Paladins' Guild
desc: "   The walls here are decorated in the silver and blue of the paladin.
Conservative tapestries depict the paladins of legend meeting out justice
in the name of virtue.  The granite walls are also decorated with scrolls
describing weapons of power donated by the gods to help the paladin in
his task.  Portals lead west back to the street and east to the Circle
of Meditation

21.name: Outside the Cathedral of Virtue
desc: "  The Cathedral of Virtue rises to dizzying heights before you.
Carved from immortal stone, the Cathedral is a bastion for what is True and
Pure throughout the lands of Midgard.  Simply standing in its shadow
fills you with peace and tranquility.
On either side of the Cathedral stand the guilds dedicated to
upholding virtue. To the west the Cleric's Guild, and to the east the
Paladin's Guild. Woodmar Lane leads the way back to the Market Plaza to
the south.

22.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   The cobblestones of Woodmar Lane provide a firm surface to walk on.
Although you pass an occasional traveler, the traffic here is not very
busy.  Immediately to you north lies Market Square, the center of everyday
business.  To the south, you can just barely make you what might be some
kind of shrine.

23.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   As you continue your walk down Woodmar Lane, you notice several
shops to your left and right.   On the east side of the street, a plain
white building reaches its way to the south.  Above the door is a sign
reading, 'The Infirmary'.  A quaint little coffee shop sits on the other
side of the street.  Woodmar Lane continues to the north and south

24.name: The Druids' Guild
desc: "   The Druids' Guild is remarkably...green.  Most of the stone floor has
been removed, and all sorts of plants have taken root in the exposed
soil.  A small waterfall trickles in from the northwest corner of the
room to provide nourishment and skylights let in more than enought sun.
A staircase carved in the center of a hollow tree leads down.  The only
other exit leads west back to Woodmar Lane.

25.name: Cafe De Midgard
desc: "   A row of bar stools lines the counter at the north wall.  There, all
sorts of patrons dip tea while discussing politics, weather, and several
other tea time topics.  You can leave the cafe to the east.

26.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   Tall buildings on either side of the street shelter you from the
harsh sun.  This is certainly more plesent than pushing through the
crowds in Market Plaza!  You see an extension of what might be a hospital
to the east, but there's no door.  To the west is the fameous Owl's Nest
Inn.  Of course, Woodmar Lane continues to the north and south.

27.name: The Lobby of the Owl's Nest
desc: "  Since the forclosure on the Grunting Boar Inn, the Owl's Nest has
become a haven for the tired traveler.  Several chandileres bearing
real wax candles bring a cheerful light to the room.  Most people here
are sitting around tables, telling greatly exaggerated tales of their
latest adventures.
The doorway to the south looks like it leads to the bar, and the one
to the east will take you back to Woodmar Lane.

28.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   Glancing around, you notice a building to the east.   A green oak leaf
painted above the door indicates that it's probably the Druids' Guild.  To
the south, the Midgard Shrine of Neutrality peeks over the horizon.
Although Woodmar Lane makes its way to the north, it's cut off by a cross
street to the south.

29.name: The Infirmary Waiting Room
desc: "   The walls of the waiting room are very white and (probably) very
steril.  Some plain, functional furniture provides a place for you to
take a load off if you're waiting for someone.  A receptionist sits
at a small counter on the east wall.  Exits lead west to Woodmar Lane
and south to the Infirmary.

30.name: The Owl's Nest Inn
desc: "   Although the bar at the south is getting a lot of attention, it's not
the bustling madhouse that you're used to in taverns.  Most of the patrons
seem to be either politely talking with their neighbors or brooding over
their drinks.  The barmaids and waiters are well groomed and plesent and
*gasp* the glasses are actually clean!  Exits lead north and up to the
reception

31.name: The Reception
desc: "   The receptionist sits behind a long, oak counter.  Behind her, the
wall is covered with room keys.  Evidently, you'll need to talk to her
if you want a room for the night.  A small note sits on the counter.

32.name: The Infirmary
desc: "  The walls here are stark white and unadorned.  You guess that the
interior designer figured that sick and dying people had better things
to worry about than the decor.  The only exit leads north.

33.name: Circle Way
desc: "   You're standing just outside the northern entrance to the Shrine of
Neutrality.  Placed right in the center of Midgard, the Shrine is a
symbol of Midgard's acceptance of all things, good and evil.  A sign
above the doorway to the south indicates that this is the 'portal of
spirituality'.  To the east and west, Circle Way continues its path
around the Shrine, while Woodmar lane streches off in the distance to
the north.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||    C e n t r a l    ||.   The Shrine of   .. . . ..  .. .
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||.     Neutrality    .. . ..  . . . .
:...  Main Street                        Main Street

34.name: Circle Way
desc: "   Circle Way continues its path around the Shrine of Neutrality to the
south and west.  Glancing around, you notice a small shop huddled on
the corner to the east.  Although the paint is badly faded, you can
barely make out a sign reading, 'Th  H rbal st' hanging above the door.

35.name: Circle Way
desc: "   The brick road curves here heading to the north and east.  To the south
west, the sandstone pillars of the Shrine of Neutrality reach their way
towards the sky.  A small building, possibly a shop, perches on a corner
northeast of here.

36.name: Circle Way
desc: "   You see a tiny little shop to the north.  Evidently, the owner was
too poor to afford a better location in town...or even to afford repairs.
If there were shutters on the windows, they have long since fallen off.
Someone has scratched the word 'herbalist' above the door with white
chalk.  Circle Way continues to the south and west.

37.name: Circle Way
desc: "   You're standing at the east entrance of the Midgard Shrine of Neutrality.
A sign carved in common above the huge doorway labels this as the 'portal
of the rising sun'.   To the east, Main Street leads the way to the
residential portion of Midgard.  Circle Way resumes its path around the
Shrine to the north and south.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||    C e n t r a l    ||.   The Shrine of   .. . . ..  .. .
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||.     Neutrality    .. . ..  . . . .
:...  Main Street                    *   Main Street

38.name: Circle Way
desc: "   A beautiful river to the southeast steadily makes its way parallel to
Circle Way.  At the edge of the river, you see several small childern
trying to see how many times they can skip a stone across its surface
before it disappears into the river.  Across the water, you can make out
a thin column of smoke rising from one of the buildings in Midgard's
Industrial Zone.   Exits to the north and west lead to Circle Way.

39.name: Circle Way
desc: "   The crystal waters of the Inverness River make their way from the
northeast to the south.  Small paths lead off of Circle Way to the
side of the river.  Unfortunately, the water moves much too swiftly
for a safe crossing.  Circle Way circles to the south and east.

40.name: Circle Way
desc: "  The sandstone pillars of the Shrine of Neutrality adorn the northwest
portion of Circle Way.  Peeking between two pillars you can barely make
you what might be some sort of altar in the center.  Of course, Circle
Way bends west to north

41.name: Circle Way
desc: "   You're standing at the southern entrance to the Midgard Shrine of
Neutrality.  A sign hanging above the sandstone entrance marks this as
the 'portal of rebellion'.  Far to the south, a huge platform has been
built above the Inverness River to accomodate the junction two roads.
You can enter the Shrine to the north, take Circle Road to the east or
west, or hop onto Woodmar Lane to the south.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||    C e n t r a l    ||.   The Shrine of   .. . . ..  .. .
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||.     Neutrality    .. . ..  . . . .
:...  Main Street         Shrine         Main Street

42.name: Circle Way
desc: "   A small grove of trees provides a plesent shade as you make your
way along Circle Way.  Just east of here, you see the southern entrance
to the Shrine of Neutrality.  The road continues to the north and east.

43.name: Circle Way
desc: "   A few trees and some bushes line the edges of Circle Way.  The chirping
of birds and a cool breeze make your walk along the road all that much
more enjoyable.  Although you can make out some shops to the southwest,
the trees make it difficult to determine what they might be.  The road
curves from the south to the west.

44.name: Circle Way
desc: "  Glancing around, you see at least three shops and a small tower to the
southwest.  Judging from the burst of flame and explosions which appear
periodically, you think that they're probably in the mystical zone.
Perhaps you should continue before something streaks from one of the
shops and hits you.  Exits lead north and east.

45.name: Circle Way
desc: "   You are standing at the western entrance to the Midgard Shrine of
Neutrality.  A sign hanging above the huge doorway indicates that this
is the 'portal of the setting sun'.  The Circle Way continues its orbit
to the north and south.  Main Street lies to the west, or you can enter
the Shrine to the east.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||    C e n t r a l    ||.   The Shrine of   .. . . ..  .. .
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||.     Neutrality    .. . ..  . . . .
:...  Main Street  *                     Main Street

46.name: Circle Way
desc: "   Continuing its way around the Shrine of Neutrality, the Circle Way
bends from the south to the east.  Far to the northwest, you see a
large building sitting on the horizon.  Perhaps it's the Midgard
Shopping Centre...it's hard to tell from this distance.

47.name: Circle Way
desc: "  There's not much exciting going at at this point.  The road has become
slightly worn, but that's about it.  The road leads both west and north.

48.name: Circle Way
desc: "   To the east you can barely make out the northern entrance to the Shrine
of Neutrality.  True to its course, Circle Way turns from the est to
the south.  The pillars of the Shrine look to the southeast.

49.name: Main Street
desc: "  You're standing on the main street of Midgard.  Main Street stretches
its way west and eventually turns south.  To the south, a sign reading
'The Cow's Bounty' hanges above an open door.  The crowds of Market
Plaza can be heard to the west.

50.name: Main Street
desc: "   The red brick of Main Street provides a firm footing as you make
your way around town.  Here, the street is wide enough to allow two
whole ox carts to travel abreast.  A cute iron wrought gate in to the
north leads to the park.

51.name: Main Street
desc: "   A huge building to the south catches your attention.  The granite
walls rise four stories into the air.  A bright yellow dome at the
top is supposed to be gold plated, but it's not fooling anyone.  This
could only be the Non-Denominational Church of Midgard!  Main Street
continues east and west.

52.name: Main Street
desc: "      At this point, Main Street makes a gentle curve from west to south.
The yelping of dogs from the east catches your attention.  A sign
above the door of the shop reads, 'The Pet Shoppe'.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||. To The ....... ... . .         of Midgard       :
:....                     You are here-->*    %%%%%%..       Centre           :
:........      The Shrine         ___      |---|   .     &&&& - Inverness     :
:........     of Neutrality    --'&&&`----/ QG |. . .           River         :

53.name: Main Street
desc: "   To the west sits the Non-Denominational Church of Midgard.  Home of
anyone who wishes to worship in their own fashion, the church is strangly
deserted.  Perhaps everyone is praying at home...Anyway, the Rangers'
Guild lies just across the street from the church, while Main Street
continues to the north and the south.

54.name: The Pet Shoppe
desc: "   The entire floor here is covered with newspaper to prevent the
assortment of birds, dogs, and other beasts from lowering the property
value any further.  Cages line all of the walls here...most of them
close...some of them not.  A little old lady sits behind the counter
on the east wall.

55.name: The Rangers' Guild
desc: "   In the center of the room is an ornate statue of a wolf.  The walls
are covered with green and brown tapestries depicting animals frolicing
in the woods.  Exits here lead west back out to Main Street and up to
the Rangers Lair.

56.name: The Non-Denominational Church of Midgard
desc: "  It certainly looked much bigger on the outside...A few ragged pews line
the walls and a granite altar sits at the front of the room.  Of course,
there's no kind of religious icon or decoration in the whole place.  The
only exit is to the east.

57.name: Main Street
desc: "   My, my...this certainly is a happy part of town.  Music and laughter
seem to be coming from both sides of the street.   To the west, a lute
hanging above the doorway identifies the building at the Bards' Guild.
Looking the other way, you spy several very well dressed people entering
the building to the east.  Ahhh..that must be the legendary Amber Rose
Restraunt.  Main Street stretches away to the north and south.

58.name: The Bards' Guild
desc: "   Well, this is either the Bards' Guild or a music shop.  All sorts of
beautifully crafted instruments sit inside glass counters.  In the corner
a minstrel sings of a battle between an evil dragon and a beautiful
maiden.  Exits lead west and east.

59.name: Lobby of the Amber Rose Restraunt
desc: "   The ceder walls give off a plesent odor as you enter the building.  Deep
red roses climb the sides of the oak columns supporting the roof at all
corners.  A skylight in the ceiling lets in just enough light to see
by.  It's a rather beautiful effect.  A doorway to the south leads to
the dining room proper.

60.name: Main Street
desc: " To the east, the Inverness River makes its way down from the mountains
and into Midgard.  It seems to go under Main Street to the south and
continues to the southwest.  A large marble building to the west catches
your eye next.  The words, 'Midgard Towne Hall' are carved above the door in
bold letters.  Main Street goes north and south from here.

61.name: Midgard Towne Hall
desc: "   A tremendous oak desk sits in one corner of the room.  Evidently,
that's where the Mayor makes all the big decisions when he's in.  A
stack of papers sits in both the IN and OUT boxes.  Of course, the IN
box is _much_ bigger than the out.  The only exit leads east to Main
Street.

62.name: A Bridge on Main Street
desc: "   The people of Midgard have built a bridge here to cross the Inverness
as it makes its way through Midgard.  To the south, Main Street makes
a turn to the west.  Since the Inverness runs southwest, another bridge
crosses back to the west bank further down.  Exits lead north and south.

63.name: Main Street
desc: "  You're stading on the east bank of the Inverness on Main Street.  The
deep blue river runs soutwest and cuts across Main Street both to the
north and to the southwest.  To the south, Main Street turns to the
west.  A sign above a shop to the west reads, 'The Fisherman's Wharf'.
Main Street continues to the north and the south.

64.name: A Bridge on Main Street
desc: "   The blue ribbon of the Inverness makes its way steadily through the
town.  From here, you can see a large circle of stone to the west.  Ah,
that must be the Shrine of Neutrality.  Main Street leads both to the
east and the west.

65.name: Main Street
desc: "   The sandstone columns of the Shrine of Neutrality loom on the western
horizon.  A non-descript stone building sits on the north curb.  A sign
above the door identifies it as the, 'Midgard Defense Headquarters'.
Main Street continues to the east, but is cut off by Circle Way to the
west.

66.name: The Midgard Defense Headquarters
desc: "   From the look of it, this is where the administration of city guards
takes place.  A large desk at the north wall contains all sorts of papers
above guard placement, shifts, wages, etc.  The only exit is to the south.

67.name: The Fisherman's Wharf
desc: "   Fishing tackle, line, rods, and all other kinds of equipment hangs
from the walls.  Evidently, this merchant sells anything needed to enjoy
a fishing trip on the Inverness, perhaps even a boat or two.  The exit
to the west leads back to Main Street.

68.name: The Herbalist
desc: "  Small plants, bottles, and chopped leaves litter the floor.  Various
recipies and shopping lists all but cover an antique wooden desk.  It
looks like this place could use a good cleaning.  Exits lead west and
south to Circle Way

69.name: Main Street
desc: "   You're standing on Midgard's most popular road: The Main Street.  To
the west, Main Street continues for a ways before turning south.  You can
hear the din of the crowd from Market Square to the east.

70.name: Main Street
desc: "   The road here has thickened until it's at least 20 meters across.  The
red brick is evenly spaced and shows little wear.  To the north, you see
a tiny well kept shop.  A small sign in the shape of a dagger proclaims,
'Ye Small Arms Shoppe'.  Another building to the south sports a much
bigger sign reading, 'The Museum of Midgard'.

71.name: Ye Small Arms Shoppe
desc: "   All kinds of small arms from daggers to hand maces adorn the walls
of this shop.  Some of the more ornate weapons are kept inside glass
cases to prevent theft.  The only exit is to the south.

72.name: Main Street
desc: "   Just up ahead to the west, Main Street takes a turn to the south.  An
awful lot of music and laughter is coming from a building on the southern
side of the street.  A sign above the door reads, 'The Silver Feather
Tavern'.  To the northwest, you see the entrance to the Midgard Zoo.

73.name: Main Street
desc: "   The street here curves and resumes its trek to the south and east.
To the north, a huge archway marks the entrance to the Midgard Zoo.
Also, The Silver Feather makes its home on the southeastern corner.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..||  N o r t h W e s t  ||............ . ... . .       a - The Silver       :
:..||    M i d g a r d    ||............ . . ... . .         Feather Tavern   :
:....You are here............             . . . ..E. ..      Shopping Centre  :
:.......| *   Main Street                         s      c - The Museum of    :
:.%%%%%-+  +------------     The Shrine                  N Gui - Ninjas'      :
: %%%%%      Main Street    of Neutrality                        Guild        :

74.name: Main Street
desc: "   To the west is the famous Silver Feather Tavern.  Many a traveler has
lost his lunch to the powerful liquor served there in.  Unfortunately,
there doesn't appear to be a door here.  Just to the north, the street
makes a turn and continues to the east.  The street also leads south
from here.

75.name: Main Street
desc: "   A huge sign perched on the east side of the street identifies the
Silver Feather Inn.  This is, evidently, the main entrance.  Although
the building is in good repair, you see more than one shingle getting
ready to fall lose.  Appropriately, the Barbarians' Guild sits just
across the street.  Main Street continues north and south.

76.name: The Silver Feather Tavern
desc: "   Wow...what a party!  People are all crowded around the bar in an
effort to get a drink.  Several people have passed out on the floor,
and give a slight groan when stepped on.  All kinds of activities
from arm wrestling to drinking contest to knife throwing are going on
all around you.  To the north, you see an exit leading to a public room.
An exit to the west leads to Main Street.

77.name: The Silver Feather Tavern
desc: "   Most people here are sitting around tables telling stories.  A
drunken minstrel in the corner sings a baudy song of the good ole days
when men were free and the women were too.  An exit to the south leads
to the bar, while the one to the north leads back to Main Street.

78.name: Main Street
desc: "   As Main Street continues north and south, guilds line either side
of the street.  On the west, there's the Cavalier's Guild.  Similarily,
the east side has the Ninja's Guild.  Waaaayyy far to the north, you
see the huge arch that marks the entrance to the Midgard Zoo.

79.name: The Ninjas' Guild
desc: "   The walls here are decorated with the implements of the Ninja.
Under the protection of a glass case lie ancient scrolls detailing
both the laws of your guild and the methods by which it practices.
A curtain to the south leads to the Ninjas' Lair and a door to
the west leads outside.

80.name: The Cavilers' Guild
desc: "   A bastion of honor, the Cavilers' Guild is where those who put Honor
above all else come to train.  The walls and floor are all exquisitly
decorated is the red and white of the Caviler.  Exits lead west to the
Sanctorum and east back to Main Street.

81.name: The Barbarian's Guild
desc: "   All kinds of animal tropheys adorn the walls of the guild.  Ornate
statues have been carved from animal bones and bits of rock.  The floor
is carpeted in a thick layer of animal skins and furs.  Exits leads
west to the Practice Field and east to Main Street.

82.name: Main Street
desc: "  You find yourself standing outside the Midgard Shopping Center.  If
you can't find it anywhere else, you can probably find it in here.
Although Main Street continues to the north and south, it seems to
curve back to the east as you look a bit further.

83.name: The Midgard Shopping Centre
desc: "   All kinds of clothing, dryed goods, camping equipment, childrens
toys and thousands of other things too numerous to mention hang from
racks and sit on shelves.  Although there doesn't appear to be a shop
keeper here, you can see one over to the south.  An exit to the west
leads back to main street.

84.name: Main Street
desc: "  Looking down Main Street, you see that it makes a bit of a turn to
the east.  Right now, you're standing outside the Midgard Shopping Centre.
Exits lead both north and south.

85.name: The Midgard Shopping Centre
desc: "   Although there are a lot of things here, most of them seem to be
clothing related.  Racks and racks of the stuff are scattered
throughout the store.  A merchant is here, selling his wares.  Exits
lead west back to the road and north to another portion of the Shopping
Centre.

86.name: Main Street
desc: "   Main Street curves here from the north to the west, where it crosses
the Inverness back to the west bank.  To the northeast, you see what
looks like a fishermans cabin.  Far to the south, a plume of smoke
rises from the roof of one of the building in the industrial section of
Midgard.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..|| E a s t C e n t r a l ||........ . ... . .         a - Rings and Things :
:..||      M i d g a r d    ||.........|   ... . .       b - Midgard Info.    :
:.............|   Market   |......| f  | M |     |. .    d - The Infirmiry    :
:.............| a ||  || b |...|Ba Gui | n |    |... .   f - NonDemon. Church :
:..           of Neutrality       ___    * |QG |.. .     &&&& - Inverness     :

87.name: A Quick-Go Booth
desc: QUICK-GO BOOTH
Midgard's Public Access Teleportation System
This port connects to the:
I N V E R N E S S   R I V E R
Please step west if this is your stop.  Make sure to
visit the Amber Rose Restraunt sometime during your stay
Have a nice day. =)

88.name: Main Street
desc: "  At this point, Main Street takes a bit of a turn and decides to run
north and east for a change.  To the north, a few guilds and shops line
either side of the street.  A large gate lies to the west and a few blocks
to the east, you can make out the Midgard Shrine of Neutrality.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:..|| W e s t  C e n t r a l  ||.. North to ... .         %%%%- West Gate
:..||      M i d g a r d      ||. Market Plaza .. . .       a - Midgard
:.....%%%%%   *  Main Street    of Neutrality         Eastward!

89.name: Main Street
desc: "   The red brick path continues to thread its way through the shops of
Midgard.  Just east of here, the Circle Way wraps its way around the Shrine
of Neutrality.  Main Street continues to the west.

90.name: A Quick-Go Booth
desc: QUICK-GO BOOTH
Midgard's Public Access Teleportation System
This port connects to the:
T H E   W E S T   G A T E   O F   M I D G A R D
Please step east if this is your stop.  Walk east,
north, and west twice to reach the edge of town.
Have a nice day. =)

91.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "  A pair of crossed swords on the doors indicate that the building east
of here is the Warriors' Guild.  Behind the guild, the blue waters of
the Inverness make their way to the south.  To the north, Circle Way
makes a complete loop around the Midgard Shrine of Neutrality.  Woodmar
Lane continues to the south.

92.name: Before a Stone Building
desc: "  The entrance to a dull grey building lies to the north.  The architecture of
the building resembles mostly a church, or perhaps a school building.
The house raises up into - two floors the first floor lacks windows, and the
second one has several, allowing vision in all directions.  Two well
polished stone statues guard the lower steps leading up towards the house
entrance, a sturdy wooden door with reinforced steel-frames.  The house
itself looks like it stood here for centuries, with its once white colour,
now fading into grey, as rain and wind beats the stone walls. The steps and
statues are kept neatly cleaned; a strong contrast against the dirty
surroundings.
Constructed out of stone, the weather and time has shifted the colour to
pale-grey from its once beautiful milk-white.
"  A strong frame of steel has been merged in between the stone arch and the
thick oak. A iron door knocker has been attached to the door, delicate
handcraft.

93.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   Just south of here, the Inverness turns southeast to cut right across
Woodmar Lane.  Unfortunately, Iron Road intersects Woodmar at the same
place.  In light of this, the Midgard Transportation Division has created
a huge raised wharf to serve as a four way intersection on top of the
river.  You can board the wharf to the south.

94.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   You're at the northern part of a wharf that serves as an intersection
for Woodmar Lane and the Iron Road.  Far to the north, you can make out
the shadow of the Shrine of Neutrality.  The wharf stretches out in the
other three directions.

95.name: Northeast Wharf
desc: "   This corner of the wharf offers the best view of the Inverness River.
The deep blue waters churn through the wharf's support posts and disappear
below.  Exits lead south and west back to the wharf.

96.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   From this point on the wharf you can see almost all of Midgard's
industrial zone to the east.  A small plume of smoke rises from the
blacksmith's shop and a large pile of rotting compost sits in front
of the recycling centre.  Iron Road leads into the industrial zone to
the east, while the wharf stretches to the north, south, and west.

97.name: The Northern Section of Wharf
desc: "   You are in a busy market, the hustle and bustle is near deafening.  There
is a strong reeking smell of fresh fish from the shop behind you.  To the
west you can see a tall statue, and further beyond a pub that looks very
tempting, if only the smell of fish would ever leave, this would not be a bad
place to spend a few hours.

98.name: The Northern Section of Wharf
desc: "   You are in the centre of the wharf.  This is where all the business is
carried out, and by the sounds of it payment in coin other than gold.  The
old women are haggling at the price of fish and the merchants at the cost
of the latest imported silks.  Now and then you see the odd group of road-
weary adventurers trudging through the crowds in their armor, or a lone
silent one slipping his way through.  All this is lost though in the milling
crowds.  In the centre stands a lone statue of a dolphin and boy,
a small plaque holds the tale.   To the southwest you can see the outline
of the Cathedral of Corruption.
"   This statue was erected in the reign of Hy Raerl and commemorates an ancient
promise between the dolphins and Midgard, that no dolphin will be killed by
an Midgardian in Midgardian waters.  This treaty arose after a dolphin was
seen fighting off the sea-predators, saving Hy Raerl's son and then carrying the
young boy back to the Wharf.  Since then dolphins have been beloved of the
people of Midgard.

99.name: The Northern Section of Wharf
desc: "   Here in a corner of the market, keeping out of the way, you look
closely at the crowds.  There are beggars a plenty, and successful ones too.
It seems as if they are being treated with more care than beggars deserve.
As always the merchants seem to be doing a roaring trade, roaring being an
apt description of their sales technique, but they too are very strongly
built and looking at the speed with which they catch the odd street urchin
trying to steal something from a stall, fast off the mark as well.

100.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   Just west of here, you spy a clump of four or five shops huddled
together.  Judging from the explosions and the periodic flashes of light,
you'd say that they all had something to do with magic.  On the north
and south horizons, you can make out the Shrine of Neutrality and the
Cathedral of Corruption, respectively.  The Iron Road leads off to the
west toward the magic shops.  All other exits lead back to the wharf.
To the south Dark Lane leads towards the Cathedral of Corruption.

101.name: The Pier's End
desc: You are quite a distance out to sea here.  Fishermen and their big
trawlers are docked here, there is a very strong smell of fresh fish.  Only
the big boats dock here, the rest dock along the wharf itself, where the
water is shallower.  Up ahead you can see some sailing ships.  These are
obviously the private yachts of the rich nobility.  Down at the other
end of the pier you can see the ferries loading and unloading their cargo,
both people and luggage.

102.name: Iron Road Junction
desc: "  You are at the start of the wharf.  The strong wooden planks hardly
sway with the swell of the water flowing underneath.  This point is
the junction of the Iron road running both east and west from here
and Woodmar Lane.  Looking south you can see the large expanse of the
bay with the great Cathedral of Corruption to the southwest and the
old city wall ending at the shipyard.  The rest is just wharf and sea.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.  There is also a small access
hatch for going beneath the wharf itself.
:.Section  Iron Road                      Iron Road ___     Industrial Section

103.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  This part of Iron Road is situated between two branches of the river.
Just north of here, the Inverness branches to the southeast before
continuing its journey southwestward.  The southeast branch curls its
way south and passes under a bridge to the east.  To the west, you see
the beginning of the wharf which serves as a crossroads.

105.name: A Bridge on The Iron Road
desc: "   This hardwood bridge makes a graceful arc over one of the tributaries
of the Inverness river.  Just east of here, the road becomes a bit
rougher as it enters the industrial center of Midgard.  You can see a
blacksmith and armourer on the north side of the street, as well as
a weaponsmith on the south.  Iron Road runs to the east and west from
here.

106.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  The cobble stones of the road are covered in a black soot.  Although
it's not as pleasant to walk on as Main Street, a paved road is better
than nothing.  A sign in the shape of an anvil hangs from a shop to the
north.  The Iron Road continues to the east and the west.

107.name: The Blacksmith
desc: "   The basalt walls of the blacksmith's shop act as a terrific insulator.
As a result, the fire from the forge makes things _hot_ in here.  Still,
this is the best place to be if you need something fixed.
There is a sign here please READ it.
Please give the blacksmiths items to be repaired, he will fix and return
them to you. If you dont have enough money he wont fix it but will give
it back to you.

108.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  The street here is littered with small scraps of leather and twisted
metal.  Shops on either side of the street indicate that you've reached
the very heart of the industrial zone.  A sign in the shape of a shield
hanging from the north building reads, 'The Armoury of Midgard'.  A
similar sign on the south building labels it as the weaponsmith.
Meanwhile, Iron Road continues its journey east and west.

109.name: The Armoury
desc: "   The armourer has displayed some of his finer wares on sturdy wooden
statues.  You've little doubt that most of this equipment is newly made.
The only exit leads back to Iron Road to the south.

110.name: The Weapon Shoppe
desc: "   All kinds and shapes of weapons, from the ornate to the deadly, hang
from the back wall of the shop.  The weaponsmith has carefully kept
everything out of reach of the casual observer.  Although you don't
see any small weapons, you're sure that you could find them someplace
else in Midgard  An exit to the north leads back to the Iron Road.

111.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  The Iron Road decides to make a bit of a turn here as it heads from
the south to the west.  On the southwest corner, you spy a building that
is most likely the weaponshop.  Just southeast of here, an abandoned
building sits on the side of the road.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:.........&&&&&&&<-- The Inverness River .......|. . .     b - The Armoury     :
:       Iron Road ___     Iron Road    * |----..... . .    e - Quick-Go Booth  :

112.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   Weaving your away around an occasional pothole in the cobblestone street,
you continues you march through the industrial section of Midgard.  The
side of the weaponshop is directly to the west.  On the other side of the
street, the remains of an abandoned building looks like it's getting ready
to topple over.  The Iron Road leads both north and south.

113.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  The road has become worse since you entered the industrial zone.  Huge
potholes several feet across litter the cobblestone street.  A horrible
smell is coming from somewhere to the south.  Glancing in that direction,
you see a large heap of garbage and a building at the end of the road.
What appears to be a warehouse sits on the west curb.  The road leads
both north and south.

114.name: The Thieves' Guild
desc: "   The boards of the floor creak painfully as you step around the
abandoned building.  A small sign scratched in the floor identifies
this as the Thieves' Guild..but it looks like it's been deserted.
Exits lead west back to the road and down through a gaping hole in the
floor.

115.name: An Abandoned Warehouse
desc: "  This place has been stripped bare.  If it was ever used to hold anything,
you have no idea what it might have been.  The place doesn't look quite
stable and if you stay here much longer it might crumble down upon you.

116.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   The further south you go, the worst the smell gets.  It seems to be
coming from the huge piles of trash on the east side of the street.
Conversely, a pristine little blue booth perches happily on the west
curb.  The Iron Road continues to the north and south.

117.name: A Quick-Go Booth
desc: QUICK-GO BOOTH
Midgard's Public Access Teleportation System
This port connects to the:
I N D U S T R I A L   Z O N E
Please step east if this is your stop.  Don't forget
to stop by the blacksmith to repair damaged goods!
Have a nice day. =)

118.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   You're standing outside the soon-to-be-famous Midgard Sewage Treatment
Centre.  You know, sewage just doesn't get all the glamor and glory that
it deserves.  In the sewage center, they're learning how to transform
the garbage heaps to the east to usuable compost to the west.  Very
important stuff.  The Iron Road leads north.

119.name: North End of The Dump
desc: "  *This* is where that horrible smell is coming from.  This is the
trash heap where all of Midgard dumps its garbage.  Come to think of it,
you might as well dump whatever trash you might have with you.  The
dump continues to the south, and Iron Road lies to the west.

120.name: South End of The Dump
desc: "  The trash here is piled really high.  Luckily, the Sewage Treatment
Centre has started trying to figure out what to do with all the garbage
before it engulfs the entire town.  The trash heap continues to the
north and Iron Road lies to the west.

121.name: A Compost Pile
desc: "   Althougth the compost pile is just as large as the dump, it's covered
with a thick burlap tarp and doesn't smell quite as much.  Eventually,
the fully decayed compost in this pile will be spread around Midgard to
provide a rich soil for the plant life.  Ah...the wonders of modern
technology.  The only exit leads east to the Iron Road.

122.name: The Midgard Sewage Treatment Centre
desc: "  All sorts experiments on trash and other disposables are lying on
a huge lab table in the center of the room.  Various pieces of trash
in different states of decomposition are kept in glass beakers around
the room.  The only exit leads north.

123.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   The cobblestone road here is in very good condition.  Archaic runes
crawl across a sign on the building to the north.  When you try to make
out what they say, they simply swim before your eyes.  Probably magical.
A bit to the east, the Iron Road ends in a large wharf covering the
Inverness River.  The Iron Road also continues to the west.

124.name: The Magic-Users' Guild
desc: "  Tombs of magic cover the floor of the Guild.  Viles of reagents and
scrolls cover any and all available desk space.  The smell of burnt sulfur
indicates that powerful magic was performed here not too long ago...could
have been someone in training.  A mystical portal on the north wall and
the doorway back to Iron Road are the only ways out.

125.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  Although the road is in good condition, you notice several black marks
where the stone has been charred by fire.  It's a good thing they make
most of the buildings in this districts out of stone...A sign on the
building to the south reads, 'The Illusionsts' Guild' while the one
on the building to the north reads, 'Magic Shop: Mystle's Mystics'.  The
Iron Road makes its way east and west from here.

126.name: The Illusionists' Guild
desc: "   It's hard to say exactly what this room looks like with all the
illusions running around.  Tiny dragons slay mystical beasts as the
floor opens to reveal the fiery pits of hell.  A portal on the east
wall looks like it might lead somewhere...if it would stay still long
enough.  An exit on the north wall leads back to the Iron Road...or
Valhalla, it's hard to say.

127.name: Mystle's Mystics
desc: "   Welcome to Mystle's Mystics.  Here, Mystle tries to bring magic into
the everyday life of the individual.  If you need a magicial scroll,
wand, or staff, this is the place to look first.  Bookshelves here are
neatly arranged in orderly columns.  Exits lead both south and west to
The Iron Road.

128.name: The Iron Road
desc: "    At this point, the Iron Road reaches both to the east and the north.
The buildings to the west are completely burnt to the ground.  The only
explanation for this is if people where hurtling fireballs down Iron
Road at the very spot you're standing...Nah...Mystil's Mystics, the
magic shop, is just northeast of here.  Fern Road starts just to the
south of here.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:.... West Gate ............   Shrine of   .. ...                             :
:.Tower    | d |...|M Gui|. |            |...... .  ..           Guild        :
:.......|/   Main Street         Wharf                           Guild        :

129.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   There's a very large scorch mark in the road here, as if it was
repeatedly blasted with some sort of mystical fire.   You warily avoid
the blackened earth as you take in your surroundings.  The Iron road
makes a turn to the east just south of here and a strange spherical
building lies to the north east.  The Magic Shop sits on the curb to
the east.

130.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   To the east is one of the most bizarre shops that you've ever seen.
With the exception of a small door, there's no other way in or out.
The entire building is shaped like a giant, 20 faced prisim.  A small
sign above the door identifies it as 'The Strange and Unusual Things
Shop'.  The Iron Road leads both north and south from here.

131.name: The Strange and Unusual Things Shop
desc: "  Strange, angular shelves hold the inventory for whatever this shop
happens to sell.  Unfortunatly, it's all boxed up in black, triangular
crates.  If you're going to find out what this shop sells, you're going
to have to talk to the owner.  The exit leads west back out to the
Iron Road.

132.name: The Iron Road
desc: "   A few loose cobble stones in the road makes walking here a bit of
an adventure.  Being sure not to lose your step, you take a quick look
around.  Construction on a new building is going on to the east and
a tiny blue booth sits alone on the west curb.  A sign above the booth
reads, 'Quick-Go Booth'.  The Iron Road stretches to the north and
the south.

133.name: A Construction Site
desc: "   Just the frame of the building is completed, so you're not sure
what it's going to be yet.  Stacks of wood and bags of nails can
be seen lying about the room.  The frame of a door leads back to the
Iron Road to the west.

134.name: The Iron Road
desc: "  Far to the east, you can see the southern portion of the Shrine of
Neutrality.  Immediately to the north, the Iron Road intersects
Main Street.  A small grove of trees provides a cool shade from the
heat of the sun.  Exits lead north and south.

135.name: Woodmar Lane
desc: "   Not much vegatation grows in this part of town.  The proximity to the
industrial zone probably makes survival too difficult.  Still, one or
two plants have managed to secure a foot hold here.  A large shop sits
on the east side of Woodmar Lane.  A small sign near the curb reads,
'Chay's Bows and Slings'.  To the north, you see the wharf that serves as
a crossroads for Woodmar Lane and Iron Road.  The street continues to
the south.

136.name: Chay's Bows and Slings
desc: "   All kinds of bows lie neatly stacked in one corner of the room.  Long
strips of leather hanging from racks must be either slings or bow cases,
it's hard to tell.  The only exit leads west from here.

137.name: Dark Lane
desc: "   A sign above a small shop to the east reads, 'The Happy Fletcher'.
Ah, that must be where they make and sell arrows.  Fittingly, the bow and
sling shop sits just northeast of here.  To the south, the Cathedral
of Corruption rises defiantly into the air.  Dark Lane continues to
the north and south.
A large block of marble embedded into the ground looks like it
has a map of the area etched into it.
:.......|      Iron Road        Wharf             trial
:..||   M i d g a r d   ||..|    Cath    |.... .  AvenGuil - The Avengers'    :

138.name: The Happy Fletcher
desc: "   Arrows and bolts in various states of assembly lie across the a
construction table on the south wall.  Workers busily take supplies
of arrowheads, shafts, thread and feathers and assemble them to the
completed product.  A small note lies on the counter, detailing the
inventory.

139.name: Outside the Cathedral of Corruption
desc: "   The spires of the Cathedral of Corruption leap skyward in rebellion.  The
black obsidian and basalt of the Cathedral seem to absorb all the light in
the area.  Simply standing in the shadow of the temple, you feel the raw,
untapped energy of evil...so much stronger than the good...
To either side of the temple lie the Guilds of the minions of evil.  The
Avengers' Guild rests on the east side, while the Assassins' Guild huddles
on the right.  Dark lane begins to the north.

140.name: The Assassins' Guild
desc: "   The ebony walls of the Assassins' Guild stand undecorated.  The darkness
of the room makes it difficult for you to pick out the few pieces of
furnature and a trap door in the center of the room.  An exit leads east
back to Woodmar Lane.

141.name: The Avengers' Guild
desc: "   The Avengers Guild is derth of any form of decoration or adornment.  Those
who are truly dedicated to the cause of evil have no need for the earthly
pleasures of life.  The walls, ceiling, and floor are made of a deep grey
granite.  An spiral staircase down leads to the Prayer Circle, and a door
to the west leads back outside.

142.name: The Museum of Midgard
desc: A sign hanging from the lobby reads:
M I D G A R D   M U S E U M
Closed for repairs ... come back in the spring.

143.name: Entrance to the Zoo of Midgard
desc: "   You find youself under a tremendous arch.  At the very top of the arch,
the words, 'Welcome to the Zoo of Midgard' have been painted in bright,
bold letters.  The sounds of all sorts of strange animals reaches your
ears from the north.  A crushed gravel path leads off in that direction,
and you can get on Main Street to the south.

144.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   The path makes a nice crunching sounds underfoot.  All around you,
parents lead children by the hand to show them the wonderful beasts
from outside Midgard.  Just up ahead, you see the small animal section.
Further to the north, the gravel path splits off in two directions in
front of a large building.

145.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   You've entered the beginning of the small animal setion.  Evidently,
The Zoo Planning Committee decided to put the harmless animals closer
to the entrance.  To the west, a few beavers are happily chewing on
their logs.  On the east side, one or two wargs play in the bushes.
The path continues north and south.

146.name: The Beaver Exhibit
desc: "   The beavers have managed to make a small dam out of scrap wood across
the artifical river.  Right now, they seem to be cutting down more wood
to work on a second dam in front of the first (to create a quaint two
tiered affect).  The cage exit is to the east.

147.name: The Warg Exhibit
desc: "   The zookeepers planted a small forest here for the wargs to live in.
Of course, they've tried to keep the tree cover as small as possile to
people can actually see the beasts.  The cage exit is to the west.

148.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   You've approached the end of the small animals exhibit.  The colorful
fox exhibit is off to the east, and a cute raccoon cage sits over to the
west.  A bit north of here, you see the Aquatic Centre.  The gravel path
leads back toward the entrance to the south.

149.name: The Raccoon Exhibit
desc: "  The half eaten remains of the raccoons' last meal lie scattered around
the exhibit.  Either they're very picky eaters, or the raccoons just
weren't very hungry.  Unfortunatly, there's nothing fit here for human
consumption.  You can exit the exhibit to the east.

150.name: The Fox Exhibit
desc: "   Foxes, in their bright red coats, playfully chase each other through
the artificial underbrush.  There's also a small pond in the center of
the exhibit should they ever get thirsty.  The exit is on the west wall.

151.name: Outside the Aquatic Centre
desc: "   A building with a rather large fish on top looms to the north.  The
words 'Midgard Zoo's Aquatic Centre' are plastered across the flank of
the fish.  You can enter the Centre to the north, visit the Aviary Exhibits
to the west or Reptile Exhibits to the east.  Of course, if you're sick
of the zoo, the entrance lies a bit to the south.

152.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "  The deeper you get into the zoo, the more interesting...and dangerous...
the creatures become.  The exhibit to the north contains some of the
biggest snakes that you've ever seen...it's a good thing they're locked
up.  South of here is the exhibit for small snakes.  The reptile section
continues to the east, while the Aquatic Centre and the aviary are to
the west.

153.name: The Small Snake Exhibit
desc: "   Many of the snakes have chosen the heart of an old, rotting tree as
their home.  Still more have burrowed into the soft ground to find
shelter from the sun.  The exit of the exhibit lies to the north.

154.name: The Big Snake Exhibit
desc: "   The zookeepers have provided a pseudo-jungle environment for the
snakes to live in.  Of course, it's all fake, but the snakes would never
know the difference.  You can exit the exhibit to the south.

155.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   A blast of heat catches your attention from north exhibit.  There,
tiny dragons blast each other with jets of searing flame...all in good
fun.  Just south of here, some of the largest lizards you've seen sit
on the rocks, basking in the sun.  The gravel path continues to the
east and the west.

156.name: The Drake Exhibit
desc: "   The bottom of the floor is covered with a thick layer of ash.  Just
about everything the zookeeper put in the exhibit, the drakes instantly
incinerate.  Thus, there's not much decoration here.  You can exit the
exhibit to the south.

157.name: The Komono Dragon Exhibit
desc: "   Huge rocks at least fourty meters across have been shipped in for
the komono dragons to lie on.  Ocasionally, one flips over to sun his
other side, but that's about it.  The exit leads north back to the
gravel path.

158.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   You find youself at the entrance to the Aviary.  The gravel path
will take you to the Aquatic Centre to the east or deeper into
the Aviary to the west.  The north and south exhibits contain a
few falcons and several wherries, respectively.

159.name: The Falcon Exhibit
desc: "   The falcon's here have made a big communal nest in the boughs of an
artifical tree.  Every now and then, the zookeepers release a few rabbits
in the exhibit for sport, and their remains are clearly visible.  The
only exit is to the south.

160.name: The Wherrie Exhibit
desc: "   In the center of this exhibit, you see pool where the wherries are
often seen playing in the water or catching fish with the talons on their
fore legs.  There are also a few trees with large nests in them.  The only
way out is to the north.

161.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   You've reached the west end of the Aviary.  A bit west of here, the
gravel path turns to the north toward another section of the zoo.  This
part of the Aviary has two of the most unusual flying beast: the roc
and the griffin.  To the east, the gravel path heads toward the
entrance to the Aviary.

162.name: The Roc Exhibit
desc: "  This is kind of a small room for a roc.  So small, in fact, that there's
not enough room for any kind of fake landscaping.  You feel sorry for the
poor bird that's forced to live here.  Exits to the south and west lead
back to the gravel path.

163.name: The Griffin Exhibit
desc: "  The griffins in this exhibit have rebelliously torn the artificial
landscape to shreds.  Judging from the amount of rubble, the original
scene must have been impressive.  An exit to the north will take you
back to the gravel path.

164.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   From here, the gravel path leads east into the Aviary and north
to the big cat exhibits.  A gentle breeze from the west relieves you
from the heat of the day.

165.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   Warning signs line the side of the path at about five foot intervals.
Glancing quickly, you notice that they warn you to step back from the
exhibits.  Looking west, you understand why.  A few very ferocious
white tigers stalk their artifical home.  To the east, you see the
Roc Exhibit...that's a mightly small roomm for a Roc.  The gravel
path continues north and south.

166.name: The Aquatic Centre
desc: "   Although the inside of the Aquatic Centre isn't particularily well
lit, it doesn't take your eyes too long to adjust.  To the north, you
see several huge tanks...the exhibits.  A small sign on the wall
indicates that the Midgard Zoo Administrative Offices are just east
of here.

167.name: Administrative Offices of the Midgard Zoo
desc: "   A neatly organized desk sits on the west all of these offices.  This
is where all of the decisions on how the zoo should be run are made; who
should be fed and when, etc.  There doesn't seem to be much of interest
in here.  A door to the west leads back to the Aquatic Exhibit.

168.name: The Aquatic Centre
desc: "   Looking to the west, you see the first part of the Aquatic Exhibit.
The kraken tank is so huge that it stretches far off to the north.  On
the east side, dolphins swim happily in their tank.  You can leave the
exhibit to the south, you look at some more just north of here.

171.name: The Aquatic Centre
desc: "   On the west wall is the most fantastic site in the whole zoo: the
kraken exhibit.  At great expense, the Council of Midgard had the
resident mage transport the kraken all the way from the far east sea.
The giant lobster exhibit in a tank to the east is equally impressive.
The back door to the Aquatic Center is just north of here.

174.name: Above the Aquatic Centre
desc: "  Things are much brighter in the top of the Aquatic Center.  To the west,
east, and southeast, you see the tops of the exhibit tanks.  You probably
shouldn't be up here.  How would you explain it if you fell in?  You can
either go back down the hatch or visit one of the tanks to the east and
west.

175.name: Above the Kraken Tank
desc: "  A small hole in the kraken tank provides a way to feed the beast withou
it escaping.  An air lock type system allows the zookeeper to get fish
into the tank without letting any tentacles leak out.  Exits lead down
into the tank or east to the hatch.

176.name: Above the Lobster Tank
desc: "   Most of the lobster tank is uncovered, so make sure you don't fall in.
A big bucket of small tuna rests near the southwest corner.  To the south,
you see the dolphin tank.

177.name: Above the Dolphin Tank
desc: "   Like the lobster tank, most of the dolphin tank is uncovered.  Curious,
a few dolphins peek up to get a good look at you before disappearing
below the surface of the water.  The only exits lead north back to the
lobster tank and down into the dolphin tank.

178.name: North of the Aquatic Centre
desc: "   You find youself standing at the back entrance of the Aquatic Centre.
If you wish to discover the miracles of fish life, south is the way to
go.  To the east and west, you see what looks like heavy construction.

179.name: The White Tiger Exhibit
desc: "   The zookeepers have done an impressive job in making this place
look like the natural habitat of the white tiger.  Were it not for
the manufacturer's stamp, the landscape would be very convincing.
Luckily, white tigers don't read.  An exit leads east.

180.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   Warning signs lining the edges of the path indicate that you're in
the heart of the big cat exhibit.  In the cages to the east and west,
you spy the bengal and the panther exhibits, respectively.  While looking
about, you hear a tremendous amount of roaring coming from the north.
The gravel path runs from the north to the south.

181.name: The Bengal Exhibit
desc: "   The blue waters of an artificial river flow through the center of
this exhibit to give the bengals something to drink every now and then.
The bone littering the cage indicate that feeding time passed not too
long ago.  An exit leads to the west.

182.name: The Panther Exhibit
desc: "   A small jungle has been provided by the zookeepers to make the
panthers feel at home.  Small pieces of debris litter the floor...probably
because the panthers like to chew up the landscape.  The cage door inthe
east wall leads back to the gravel road.

183.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   Now that you've approached the _really_ dangerous cats, both
warning signs and felt ropes have been put up to keep you away from
the cages.  In the exhibit to the east, a sabre tooth tiger is making
an awful lot of noise.  Evidently, it doesn't like being caged up.
On the west side of the road is the home of the shy arctic lynx.
The gravel path continues north and south.

184.name: The Arctic Lynx Exhibit
desc: "   The zookeepers somehow manage to keep the termperture here low
enough for the arctic lynx to survive.  A few scraps of meat have been
thrown on the ground, but remain untouched.  A gate to the east leds
back to the gravel path.

185.name: The Sabre Tooth Tiger Exhibit
desc: "   The landscape here has been completely decimated by the sabre tooth
tiger.  Looking around, it's hard to find pieces that are bigger than
your fist.  Deep claw marks score the ground and walls.  An exit is
to the west.

186.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: You find yourself in the northwest corner of the Zoo of Midgard.  There's
not much to see in this part, but a gravel path leads south to the exciting,
albeit dangerous, big cat exhibit.  The path also leads east into what seems
to be a construction zone.

extra.desc: The sign reads, Deadly Creature Exhibit, BEWARE!

192.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   This part of the bear exhibit seems to be under remodeling...perhaps
a new kind of bear is being brought in.  Anyway, the cages to the east
and the west are both empty.  The gravel path continues north and south.

193.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   The gravel path here runs right through the center of the bear exhibit.
The cages to the west contain unusually large kodiac bears, while the
ones to the east contain what looks like walking teddy bears with claws...
how odd.   Exits lead north and south to other portions of the bear exhibit.

194.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   This is an interesting part of the zoo.  The exhibits on either side
of the gravel path couldn't be more dissimilar.  On the east side, huge
bears scrape the bark off trees in the Werebear exhibit.  On the other side
of the path, polar bears are fishing in an artificial stream.  The gravel
path continue to the north and south.

195.name: A Crushed Gravel Path
desc: "   You're standing at the corner of two exhibits.  To the west, the
path leads to the Reptile Section.  Just north of here is the Bear
Section.  Decisions, decisions.  The gravel shifts under your feet as
you try to make up your mind.

196.name: The Polar Bear Exhibits
desc: "   A magical enchantment keeps this cage at arctic temperatures.  As a
result, the polar bears are happily fishing from an ice laden stream.  The
only exit leads east back to the gravel path.

198.name: The Kodiac Bear Exhibit
desc: "   Most of the bark has been scraped off the artificial trees by the
bears' powerful claws.  Large bones litter the back of the exhibit; must
have been feeding time recently.  The only exit leads back to the path.

199.name: The Cuddly Bear Exhibit
desc: "   This is one of the most bizarre exhibits in the zoo.  The cuddly bear
looks exactly like a cute little teddy bear...except fo the claw.  Although
they seem to be every child's dream, be careful...they're ferocious.
An exit to the west leads back to the gravel pth.

200.name: An Empty Cage
desc: "  All of the artifical foliage has been removed from here to reveal
nothing but a sprayed concrete floor.  The exit in the east wall leads
back to the gravel path.

201.name: An Empty Cage
desc: "   A metal framework in the shape of a cliff edge is halfway finished
being sprayed with morter.  It looks like they're going to put some sort
of a mountain dwelling creature in here.  The exit to the west is the
only way out

202.name: Entrance to the Park
desc: "   A gate designed more for aesthetics more than protection marks the
entrance to the Midgard Park.  A small sign has been pressed into the
the ground next to the gate.  The path through the park starts to the
north, and Main Street begins just south of here.

203.name: A Path Through the Park
desc: "  The wind whispers through your hair as you begin your journey
through the park.  The little cobblestone path provides a firm foot
as you make your way along.  Just east of here lies the Recreational
Service Centre, the administrative office of the park.  The path
exits both north and south.

204.name: The Recreational Service Centre
desc: "   All kinds of paperwork and gardening equipment are scattered about
the room.  On the wall, a list of watering, cutting, and fertilizing
dates has been faithfully kept.  The only exit is to the west.

205.name: A Path Through the Park
desc: "   The little stone path makes a bit of a turn here, and decides to go
to the east and the south.  The twittering of birds can be heard from the
north.

206.name: A Clearing in the Park
desc: "   A thick blanket of grass covers the ground in this part of the park.
The ground rises a bit to the east creating a small hill.  It looks
like the people of Midgard have done a little landscaping to the north,
and a row of bushes guides you in that direction.  Just west of here, you
can see a small iron fence.

207.name: The Edge of the Park
desc: "   A small fence similar to the gate at the entrance of the park marks
the west boundary.  Far to the west, you can barely make out the shadow
of the Cathedral of Virtue on the horizion.  The only exits leads east
back to the park clearing.

208.name: Next to  a Pleasant Shrubery
desc: "   The people of Midgard have done a wonderful job landscaping this
portion of the park.  Two small shruberies surrounded by a white
picket fence decorate the grounds.  The plot to the left has been
raised a bit to create a nice two tiered affect, and there's a quait
little path running right through the middle.

209.name: The Shade of a Tree
desc: "   A huge oak tree spreads its boughs toward the sunlight.  A few
wildflowers grow around the base of the tree, creating a picture perfect
scene.  The ground rises a bit to the south, ending in a small hill.
A broken bath lies just north of here, and there seems to be some
hedges to the west.

210.name: The Top of a Small Hill
desc: "   On top of the hill, the wind picks up a bit and plays games with
your hair.  From this height, you can see almost the entire park.
Just northwest of here, someone's done quite a job on landscaping
with some bushes.  Looking further, you see a broken stone path leading
to a duck pond.  The hill descends to the north and west.

211.name: A Path Through the Park
desc: "  Although a few tufts of grass have managed to push through the stone
path, it's in very good condition.  There's a small hill off the
path to the north.  From here, the path leads both east and west.

212.name: A Path Through the Park
desc: "  Once again, the little stone path decides to make a ninty degree
turn.  This time, it heads off towards the north and the west.  There
seems to be a much more ornate road to the northeast, and a small grassy
hill to the northwest.

213.name: A Path Through the Park
desc: "  You feel better than you have in a long time as you make your stoll
along the park way.  A little hill rises to a moderate height just
west of here, and a white bench is off the road to the east.  You can
continues on the path to the north and the south.

214.name: A Fork in the Path
desc: "   You've come to the intersection of three paths in the park.  To the
east, an ornate path crafted of fine stones leads off to the distance.
The southern path will eventually take you out of the park, and the
northern path leads deeper into the park.

215.name: A Broken Path
desc: "   The path here is paved in fragments of broken stone.  Too large to
be called gravel, the stones have a natural tendancy to turn underfoot.
Thus, your footing is often insecure, at best.  The path continues
to the east and south.

216.name: A Broken Path
desc: "   You carefully make your way along the broken path, being careful
not to slip and fall.  Just west of here, you see a small duck pond.
To the north and south, you can leave the path and frolic in the green
grass.  The path also continues to the east.

217.name: A Pond in the Park
desc: "   An artifical duck pond been dug for your viewing enjoyment.  Although
it looks tempting, the pond is way too shallow for swimming.  Cattails
and wildflowers decorate the edges of the pond.  A small broken path
stretches off to the east.

218.name: A Grass Clearing
desc: "   A wind coming off the pond from the south makes this clearing quite
a cool place to rest.  The cushion of the grass would make this the
ideal spot to lie down and take a nap.  Exits lead off to the south and
east.

219.name: A Grass Clearing
desc: "  The grass here is green and springy, the sign of a well tended grounds.
A few rabbits poke their heads up from their holes, look around a bit,
then disappear beneath the ground.  A broken path lies to the south,
and grassy fields streatch off in the other three directinos.

220.name: A Grass Clearing
desc: "   This clearing lies at the northern most portion of the park.  A little
black fence cuts and east west path and prevents anyone from traspassing
to the north.  The only exit leads back to the south.

221.name: A Grass Clearing
desc: "   The small of broken grass beneath your feet reminds you of your
childhood days.  The soft whisper of the breeze and the chirping of
the birds is about all you can hear.  South of here, a path makes its
way through the beauty of the park.

222.name: An Ornate Road
desc: "   The road here has been carefully crafted of only the finest stone.  it
must have been expensive to install such a beautiful work of art here to
serve as a walking path.  The path continues to the east, while a fork
in the road is to the west.

223.name: A Small Park Bench
desc: "   Someone's had the foresight to put a small park bench here for
weary travelers to rest.  Unfortunately, it seems to have been designed
